0MW6_BD2iYZf4Q36Ki81RQ.text: Love the staff very friendly....and they remember us.....always a good feeling. I like that they bring in the outdoor cushions when it rains...nothing worse than sitting on a wet cushion

T6usWoGSdMhZut9Li-FcoQ.text: Yesterday was a busy night, and my husband and I went to three different restaurants with insane waits before I said, "Have you heard of that World of Beer place? Let's go check it out!"   This turned out to be a great decision. We had an amazing experience from top to bottom. The food was delicious. We had the German Pretzel, with beer cheese and stone mustard sauces that were delicious. I had the Steak Fries, cooked perfectly. My husband had amazing, GIANT Korean spiced wings that were spicy and well seasoned. The beer was cold and tasty, with the insane selection they promise you from the second you walk into the door. The cooler special was awesome, so we spent some time in Great Britain for a great price before we moved to some microbrews (the Peanut Butter stout I had was one of the best stouts I ever drank).   But the service was honestly the best part of the night. My husband is in the industry and even though we live in the hospitality capital of the world, we get a lot of lackluster service. That was not the case here. Our server, Taylor, was wonderful from the moment we walked in to the moment we left. She was fun, incredibly knowledgeable, and very attentive. Our glasses were never empty! She helped us navigate the menu and provided great suggestions for both good and drink. Every moment we interacted with her, we were so impressed. Thank you for facilitating a wonderful date night, Taylor!  We're definitely coming back with family because the food is really fantastic and we obviously need to try all the beers, but we're pretty spoiled now. We'll only ever want to sit in Taylor's section!

8A1vBwapWPGgb7-kK1RHkA.text: Always a great place to sit outside on their patio, enjoy a wide variety of beer and food while watching a game. Chelsea has waited on us multiple times now, service has always been quick and she makes great suggestions. Would recommend to any local of Vegas or someone just coming through.

GdfILTGisE1Spi9Aeanz-Q.text: Damn. This place was LEGIT. I was looking for a good IPA and Chelsea suggested Hoof Hearted. It was bomb and the service was great. Thanks for the recommendation! The place was super chill and friendly. Will definitely be hitting this place back up.

fMsQPzLtv8J8X_DqN0lxrg.text: Great place for a beer. The server was amazing but they were a little under staffed and we felt bad for the server. The food was good and we enjoyed the atmosphere.

ClLgHiXaDkBGs_-WV4vQMw.text: World Of Beer!  The name says it all, plenty of great choices and the food is good to boot.   They use Cali Creamin and infuse it with fruits/dates/spices for a new concoction daily which is smooth and flavorful and on your first visit you can get a free local beer (although I hear this promotion will end soon)   Chicken wings are flavorful, tator tots great, and the German Pretzel is a monster of an appetizer lol.  Wasn't too impressed with Calamari but hey they can't all be winners right.   My favorite meal was the Hangover skillet everything you need/want in a breakfast including BACON!!   Overall service is ok sometimes underwhelming but the selection of beers, location and food will bring me back.

ovxvw-dFi0ZjqR_e99RnDg.text: Not our first time here,  but will surely be the last.  Came in after a little black Friday shopping to have a drink or two.  Sat at a high top across from the bar.  Someone came over right away to give us menus.  Waited 10 minutes and never saw anyone else again.  Had at least 4 different servers walk past our table without so much as a glance.  I can understand if the place was busy but it was practically empty.  I'll find a new place to get a beer.

FevhAhuzKxunjFkl309CTw.text: The food was good and good beer, I only did 4 stars because it is very pricey. Great environment to hangout with friends.

jed2AukTK-xg99Zyl6Ityg.text: I was skeptical about coming to this place because of my previous visit. It's wasn't horrible but it wasn't the best. This time around, we were served by Elizabeth, who was wonderful. I will definitely be back again because of her!!!

AXnzXGqupaeMaJ4_b2FNcA.text: Stopped in on 4th of July. Hip gastro pub with a huge selection of beers. Ordered a draft pale ale & Modelo especiale to drink. $5 & $6 each. Then saw the $2 & $3 draft beer specials. Wish we would have seen them earlier or the waitress had mentioned them. To eat, BF had chimichura meatball sliders w mac n cheese. I had the margarita flat bread w Caesar salad. We shared & thought both were excellent.   Service was quick, friendly & efficient. Gentleman, who we confirmed was the owner, was hands on backing the wait staff.  I would have to compliment the owner for the restaurants hip atmosphere & menu. Also for his ability to hire hustling waitresses. While it wasn't busy when we were there, I would suspect it could be often, at other times.   Overall a very pleasant dining experience. I would definitely go back & do recommend.

YkMGm0cDizKKS5RyO3VTag.text: Let me start by saying the staff service was amazing and did the best that they could so I didn't want to complain about the food but it not only took 30 mins to come out but my pork was just above room temp when it arrived at my table.  The atmosphere was nice and like I said, the staff was very nice but the food tanked the experience big time.

654bjFw7xkhJPKOb4iVYaQ.text: Chelsea is great! I stopped in for a few beers and apps on Friday night and she took care of me. Answered all of my questions that I had-- and it was a lot! I love that the patio is dog friendly too

EVqSYe7LrtAMVaCm1GrYGw.text: The selections here are awesome! Felt very welcomed  in by Vanessa and Our server, Dave had great recommendations and was always ready to help. I will definitely be back

Devin and Sarah rock the bar like I've never seen before and generally suggest some of the best beers I've ever had.   Would highly suggest checking the place out. Amazing food, great staff, outstanding beer selection

p6N7P6jXTNuwpOMfkBIV_w.text: I have only been here once during happy hour during one of the VGK final games. The happy hour time frame and pricing I thought was great. For two of us to eat and drink for a whole game was only $45. The food also had great taste. The tacos I thought would be small but we're decent size for the price. Favorite item was the pesto flatbread though! Another plus is the many options of beers. I prefer cider and they don't have many on draft but this is the largest cider selection I have found!

xrpGnq4yj-eaEk1lpu6y0w.text: No more pickles? What??? Jeremiah's service was impeccable (as always), and so were the wings. But no more pickles??? Come on!

kma5wgAsETozdVzDNvuUBQ.text: Food was good, beer was warm and service was horrible. Waited for more than 10 min to be told to sit wherever we want. We ate, then waited for our bill, and waited then waited some more. Finally caught our waitress and waited another 10 minutes for the bill. Overall very unimpressed.

EzvfcFquDZXXwf3TOLLRYg.text: Awesome service and even better food. I had the Chimay burger and Renata creek summer kolsch. Both recommended by are. Dry friendly server. Great atmosphere and wonderful staff

8sU3CyPJySCw3tAO7AjvJw.text: nice atmosphere. i had a v friendly waitress. beers good. lots of choices. ate the nachos. looking forward to trying more menu items.  derp

jJ4s4GqVqxizAxfVwMkskQ.text: Having tried a sister property in Orlando we were excited to find this opening in Las Vegas. The location is only convenient if you live in this part of the city. While we do not we aren't fully able to enjoy the place as often or for as long as we'd like. Food is awesome. Definitely recommend the pretzel with the beer cheese. Have tried many options on the menu and have yet to be disappointed (burgers, flatbread pizzas, salads etc). The beer selection is amazing. If you do a sampler they will customize your selections based on your palate preferences. Even better- if you don't like one of their choices they will exchange it- no questions asked. Service is very friendly. The owner is awesome and makes sure to greet each customer at some point. Supposedly more locations are coming to Las Vegas which would be perfect!  Make it more convenient and I'll up the review to 5-stars!

D0nyb5t9bKW2UjfOH-IACA.text: Do you like beer???   Lots and lots and lots of different beers??   Then this is DEFINITELY the place for you.   They have a cool iPad menu system that lets you sort by style, region, alcohol percentage, etc etc...   the staff is knowledgeable and friendly and the atmosphere and patio are very nice.  The tater tots are NOT to be missed...   also I like the pretzel, tacos (especially the shrimp) a lot.

BZ850OsytqfMLs-vcW3mWQ.text: This place was rad the first time we went, waitress was on it (also training at the same time) food was on point. But this time, no so much. Either the kitchen forgot to fire out app or server forgot to put it in. Ordered a shot, then 10 minutes later told the server we didn't get it, Then he came back and told us they didn't have it. Also told us he was gonna bring waters and didn't. (at this point I'm not thirsty any more) We ordered a burger and a chicken sandwich, burger was like a hockey puck and tots were cold. Probably will sit at the bar next time and just drink beer or not.

XJPsPcTOL25PvVQ3kQQKKw.text: I love this place. Beer is always fresh with an ever changing selection. The food is good, especially for bar food. The owner is cool. He always greets me with eye contact and a smile when I come in. The bartenders all know my name, they are personable, and they are all knowledgeable about the styles of beer they serve. They give samples before you buy if you ask.

lkwrBlTkw_1R7v30luS-aw.text: Great food and great staff the service is above and beyond good and the mac and cheese bites are awsome!!

After 10 min, a server walked by and said he will be right with us.  But I think he forgot cause a few minutes later we saw him cleaning tables.  Another server came over which I can tell we weren't in his section and finally helped us.  The food was okay.  We orders the steak flatbread and pretzel. e6iBuoIY8ohsbMNZ3sihzw.text: Customer service was excellent by Austin. The food was served hot and fresh in minutes. Will definitely be back!

With beers from all over the world, I never get bored with drink choices. Highly recommend coming here for both food and drinks. The atmosphere is great as well.

IP8w1MejIbL8kSbI7nHM2Q.text: One of the worst experiences, the hostess scolded the couple in front of us, and was irritated when we wanted to move to a different table. No one came over and offered water or take our beer orders. Menu is small, only breakfast items, one burger. obtrfqNtkGFI917ojoSZ8w.text: I took of my business partners for happy hour. A man kept shouting at the servers and seemed to have a lot of tension in the air. We left

hfwQruz9xkK4MFuhAM29rA.text: Burger Tuesdays are the best!  Beer selection is of course excellent.  Tasty food!  Come early for Happy hour and get the beer of the day on discount.

bhcL5kTYnpSD__5E3MB5rw.text: Matt Golightly is an awesome bartender! Very knowledgeable, friendly, and always knows the perfect IPA for every occasion!

kdTR5Tzj18U1d86sT6QmiA.text: Great food, Great service and of course Great BEER! Manager/Bartender Matt is the man!! Very knowledgeable about all the beers and runs a tight ship. Love this place!

xsF5dcfdWGey7lMza7DmDg.text: My husband and I treated ourselves to the Big Game Party at World of Beer yesterday for super bowl Sunday! With the all you can drink draft beer selection (including bottles and cans) plus call liquor and an all you can eat food buffet all for one price that included tax and gratuity we were IN! We got a great seat at the bar and our bartender was VERY attentive - our beers were always replenished before we were even finished with the one we were drinking. The buffet was filled with typical bar snacks which were good BUT I wish had a few more healthier choices (maybe more veggies and fresh fruit trays for next year .) They had a lot of raffles and giveaways, including 2 sets of VGK tickets as well! All of the staff members, including the bar manager, were really nice, really welcoming and we had a great time. We'll return for more events here in the future!

kBr_-pSQCpYNQmyD6eP33w.text: 9.10.2017 @ 1030am   This place is awe-sommeeeeee. I'm so glad we came here. We were greeted by the staff and the person helping us out was Pua? Sorry if i spelt that wrong. She was patient with our indecisive group. Since it was the first day of NFL we decided to get finger foods. (Plus we decided to binge all day)   We ordered three flights, 1. intro to hops, 2. Tour of Belgium 3. Intro to WOB flights. We all took turns tasting each sample and finished the one we choose. Yes it is worth it!!!  The finger foods we ordered were the nachos (with chili) 20 piece wings flavors parm chicken, spicy Korean and something that was sweet I forgot. Oh and tatertots. The wing sauces are made to order, pretty amazing. Everything we ordered was very good!! Tater tots were .. well taters lol can't go wrong. As far as the wings, begeezus.. So damn good. The nachos are finger lickin' good, I almost died tho.. jalapenos are kickin'!   What makes everything 10000000000x better is the amazing service we received! Pua (again sorry) John, Jen, some girl with short hair up to her shoulders managed to chime in with great service and checked on us. These people were the best part of our meal. They definitely made our experience worth while.  Hopefully we can catch the same crew on our next visit.

ZKuPD6eSTMn0NEwhn7-v4Q.text: Amazing food, Amazing drinks, Amazing Game(VGK vs Oilers), Amazing Server! Love to visit this place.

QWYVkQ-gn1w7YrPvwPzOYA.text: Two days in a row, not too impressed.  Fredi, our wonderful bartender again gets five stars.  Food gets three.  We ordered the HH Barbacoa that was terrible & dripping w/ oil.  The shredded beef was soggy w/ the overbearing sauce so I gave it to my starving guy friend & ordered another one, plain.  The plain was dry & I narrowed it down to the beef just not being right.  I shared it w/ my girlfriend & she couldn't finish her half either.  We told Fredi, but we had already paid our bill so she told the chef.  Change it please.   The Tuscan or Pesto Hummus was great, but I wish they put veggie sticks & Pita, instead of Pico de Gallo & Pita... which none of us ate.    Very nice beer selection of course & they no longer have the free beer w/ check-in offer fyi.  I'm not a beer drinker so no big deal, but it was a nice offer.    Chicken Salad after five or six bites was horrible, we thought it would get better, but it was tasteless & not totally fresh.  I thought ok let's try the Macaroni & Cheese, not the fried bites, how could we go wrong here... it was burnt w/ hardly any cheese.  What in the world!  I will say to be on the safe side the Hummus & he Chimay Burger are the best.  Other than that, some items need to be changed or done away with.  Sorry Wolf, you left before I could mention these things to you.  We will be back & hope to upgrade the stars, but it will be awhile.

zllz818hQcwHCBjS1LmIDQ.text: Went to world of beer and the sign directly in front of the restaurant said brunch was offered both Saturday and Sunday. Went to try and order brunch as it was Saturday and was told they only offer it on Sunday's . Was very disappointed . The service was slow and not great. Only one server was working for 8 tables. We got the wrong menu initially for weekday lunch and almost ordered wrong food that wasn't being served as it was the weekend. Definitely should have more staff on a Saturday at 12:00 .

photos.caption: Photo of World of Beer - Henderson, NV, United States

yleqAugoj4H3P1FA4AyIrQ.text: It wasn't very busy on our Saturday evening visit.  That should've been my clue.    We weren't extremely hungry so my better half and I decided to share a few appetizers.  Our first choice was the Green Chili Chicken Nachos.  Pretty decent coverage of toppings including cheese, black beans and jalapenos.  The menu says it's supposed to be spicy cheese but I didn't catch any of the zing.    We also shared the Beer-brined Crispy Chicken Sliders.  I would not order these again.  Very very dry and lacking any flavor.  The IPA sauce was non existent.  There was maybe a dab which you couldn't taste.  It's unfortunate.    Our service from Rachel was really good.  She was very attentive and friendly.  Although the service was good, the food needs some improvement.

QeSCTKJd-bpIzQv0Z9hY4g.text: Best food by far of any tavern in this area. I've eaten most of the appetizers (flat breads are amazing) wings great even dipping sauces are really good! Went for the beer (obviously) but the food won me over that's why I go back. You won't be disappointed.

oAqGo1HO_L5VlZVkfVkD_Q.text: Chelsea was awesome!! She has the chefs make me shrimp tacos on a Saturday when they aren't featured on their brunch menu' AND ....she never let out beers go dry!!!!

XJVi9XEQyjrQxTFX9XFa_A.text: I have only gone to their happy hour! ITS THE BOMBBB. All my classmates go there after we celebrate an exam lol  -HH is Mon-Friday 2pm-7pm & Sun-Thursday 9pm-close -They have a nice indoor + outdoor seating -Located outside the galleria mall and next to GEN KBBQ  HH DRINKS 5/5: -Bad Beat Bluffing Isn't Weisse (Hefeweizen; $4): super refreshing, this is my favorite beer here! -Woodchuck Amber (Cider; $4): if you like something that is not too bitter, this is the beer for you. Pretty sweet also :)  HH FOOD 5/5: -Tavern Taters ($5): OMG these are to die for. The tots are fried in such a crunchy/delicious manner. It's topped with jalapenos, bacon, ranch, and ALOT OF CHEESE. my favorite :D  -Magherita Flatbread ($5): Super yummy pizza. -Mac & Cheese bites ($5): These are good too. -All their HH food is share-able, so they are HUGE.

yKrQVqWu_c2QbQ-vefXT5w.text: Our waiter was beyond amazing- not only memorized the menu but gave recommendations and was so efficient and friendly. We came on a Monday for $5 burgers, which my husband and daughter both enjoyed. The Happy Hour menu offers great choices as well; I ordered the Margarita Flatbread; it is large and made with fresh ingredients. In addition to the beer and apps menu offered at Happy Hour, there are cocktails  ($5 Tito's Vodka!). I am sure this place is always great, but between the Monday burger special and Happy Hour pricing, this family of 3 enjoyed dinner and 2 rounds of drinks for less than $50!

Jm9wS3GF_2gOL-pS8wlHiQ.text: Loved it ever since they opened  Definitely my favorite place to go for taco Tuesday Shrimp tacos are amazing and I always get the white peach sangria's Not a big beer drinker (go figure lol) but the atmosphere is great location convenient

ORVGkZhTAhm2U1XD7fbGBg.text: Always love coming here For me, I don't know if it's because I'm getting older but they always keep it pretty cold in here. Please have a German pretzel. It's yummy and delicious. Service has always been good here since it's opened

0VQpOsDn4SFfXZZYV3iEqw.text: 5 stars for beer selection.  1 star for food allergy concern. I can't say I've ever been able to go out and have a gluten free beer next to my boyfriend who drinks normal beers, until now. And I've had my gluten issue for almost a decade now.  He was able to find a flight of beers they recommended and he loved which included: - lost coast great white ale - ipa (not sure the blend, but he said phanto something?) - dogfish head pumpkin ale - belching beaver nitro peanut butter milk stout And I found an entire shelf of gluten friendly beers (half off for the day) along withb3 shelves of ciders (not a personal fan but thats an opinion) including a triple Belgian by Green's and and ipa by Green's. Personally I preferred the ipa. But the triple was good too. Boyfriend also ordered a citrus-y double ipa (we don't remember the brand sorry) after his flight and enjoyed it.  Regarding the food.... they have a special "gluten friendly" menu, but upon asking about their grilled chicken (dry rub, buffalo, and garlic parmesan) we found that they are grilled and then fried in the same frier as all other breaded items. Hardly qualifies them as gluten friendly.. needless to say we weren't able to order food. But in my opinion, for a "bar" to carry am entire shelf of gluten sensitive beers, that earns a 5 star review regarding their main attraction - beer. Thanks for thinking of us gf folks.

photos.caption: Photo of World of Beer - Henderson, NV, United States. Green&#39;s gluten free beers offered
Photo of World of Beer - Henderson, NV, United States. Gluten free / gluten sensitive shelf. All the Green&#39;s are completely gf!

q2qfVpJc7CATL2K5r8ruZA.text: Service was so poor we had to leave and go somewhere else.  Hostess started by seating other walk in guests after us on the patio, resulting in us getting a high top table with our dog.  Then we and the 3 other tables on the patio sat for 10 minutes without being acknowledged. Servers came out to help older tables, but never looked at any of us. Some other table even called out to no response.   I was hoping for a nice place to go with our dog but this is certainly not it.

ccUNiLO9qPa_D7haT3jUyg.text: True to it's name, World Of Beer has a large selection of beers on tap and in bottles.  In fact, if the leaderboard is to be believed, they have more than 1000.  Many tv screens hang over the bar and there is both outdoor and indoor seating.  The food is upscale bar food. On Sundays they have breakfast and brunch including a bottomless alcohol add on for $21.00 or so.  The food is good but didn't knock my socks off. But for a mall bar it has a lot to offer.  The staff was friendly, sometimes too attentive as I was constantly asked if I needed anything, perhaps because my table was in the server's path to the bar.  Overall it is a nice addition to the galleria cuisine choices especially when you drop your teen off during football.

UtycYLtPYxyBNzFVNHjetA.text: I love this place, which is funny considering I hate beer haha. BUT, they have the largest selection of cider I've seen here, which I thoroughly appreciate! The food is also really yummy, and they have a great happy hour. I will keep coming back!

LPWaFTErEWToO9K5GzJQDg.text: This place is great. They have a large selection of beer and cider. I'm a cider fan myself. Also if you check in on yelp you get a free local beer. It's a casual friendly atmosphere. It's nice to sit outside on cooler days because they have games and fire pits and TVs. The food for the most part has been good. The beer cheese tater tots and flat breads are always a good choice. The cheesy mushroom burger is good as well. I had the chimichurry meatballs on my first visit there and they were so hard and dry, I had to saw them with my knife. This is a great place and it would be even better if the food was up to par with their diverse beer selection.

W59RIgjRcFBl1BapfV11RA.text: I love this place! The staff is excellent and I like how they all help each other out. Sarah is very friendly and knowledgeable about the menu. She recommended the Pilsner Burger and it's my new favorite thing. She also makes a killer old fashioned.  Andrew took great care of my friends and I last time we were there, as well as Nicole. Lastly, get the Pretzel Bread Pudding for dessert!  Oh and if you like beer, they have a world of it.

xPD8bRZ5Pr9V-pCKU8OTjQ.text: World of Beer is by far my go to place for anything Beer! Not only is the selection and variety better then anything in the Valley; everyone that I've come into contact with staff wise has been amazing. My first time here, Sarah was my bartender, and her upbeat attitude and willingness to answer questions about the location and the offerings made a great first impression. I've since become a pretty regular "regular", and always get treated as a good friend by Sarah, Brian, Matt, Nicole, and the rest of the team at WOB.  The happy hour specials are fantastic, all of the appetizers do not disappoint, and the flat iron steak sandwich is the bomb dot com!

WE_Dm87oIlrUf3WqpXajDg.text: Get the $25 brunch with your friends. It's the best deal and sit outside. It's literally the best. There's tv, people watching or you can just chat the morning away while getting boozy haha Food is also delicious-loved everything I've tried so far!

QwrB60RaDJcAGq23acWifA.text: Chimay burger is one of my favorites. I've never been one to visit the same resaurant more than once but I have to admit... I've been here 6 times while I was here for work. The lagunitas underground strong ale is amazing! Yummo!

ibB_r5sVA8mkpiBdx8Rz0g.text: Fast service. Good food. Friendly atmosphere. Stopped in here because I walked out of another place for no service at all and being ignored. Good job WOB!

X9G2HSnfuPTmCtQPCitFog.text: The best way to describe it - so many options:) we were able to find some beers that we haven't seen anywhere else in Las Vegas. The food menu looked great as well, they have a great Happy Hour. Only negative for me personally is location- wish it was closer to where I live but for everyone in Henderson area, it's a hidden gem.

q_LyBYEWmSjAsvzaw6J6lQ.text: I love going to world of beer there $5 Monday burger deal is the best! The staff is nice and helpful, definitely going back!

0IcZlloYW_Qq2oWkJVZf0w.text: Sat near the entrance on the couches, with some games and a TV. Came here the night before NYE, and it was fairly empty.  Our server originally was the one who showed us to our seat. Nice guy, and we expected him to host us, since he himself said he would, but halfway into the night, we had a different server- OK.  I enjoyed their infused drinks. Feel free to ask for samples. Overall, decent place- good service and atmosphere.

8na6yELmAjWc6pk9v-uYbg.text: Food is Damn good. I ordered the chicken BBQ flat bread with Mac n cheese and my husband ordered the Chimay burger and it was all super delicious. The Mac and cheese was impressively good. Ordered some drinks as well and Justin the bar tender was very attentive and helpful. Had the Fall Favorites beer flight. Great service and great food at the bar during lunch time on a Tue. Will come back for sure.

tYcdYH87lR_Mfh2ugN3YZw.text: Great beer bar,  Freddie and Pua are wonderful beer tenders.   Love them.   500 Beers in bottle and 60 on tap,  what's not like.   Good food too plus a really good happy hour daily.

elnRUJJNniqki7qj-_4T8g.text: I can't explain how great this place is. The food is amazing! The workers are phenomenal. Carolina took really good care of us and recommended a chorizo Flatbread that is to die for. Everytime is an experience here, you will not be disappointed. The pretzel and barbacoa tacos are also super juicy and rich. My favorite place.

ZdoRpgoJ_SWvgggwWSJHaQ.text: Awesome bar, plenty of space.   Came here with about 20 people on a Friday.  Not packed at all but it was perfect with how many people we had, we got our drinks very fast.   Our server Jay was awesome!! Ask for him, he helped everyone in my party out and kept the same energy the whole time.   Food was good, typical bar food; pizza, burger.   Would definitely come back because the service was top notch.   Happy drinking!!

WmQcl9FeKq_1Rhd1cbj_eA.text: Second time I have been to this place for beer and wings. The beer is really good with tons to choose .  The wings have been a real let down . They are really wet and soggy and greasy.  I ordered garlic parm extra crispy , we got wet soggy garlic .  The blue cheese is really really good but they need to focus on getting the wings right because the consistency sucks. Maybe, if you get drunk enough you won't notice. Service also is soggy like the wings.

kVCNr0JFTZVPPiR3vwgd0g.text: Decent beer selection, but both times we've been here the service has been slow. We walk in and aren't sure if we are supposed to wait or seat ourselves. We gave up and sat, but had to wait for a server to notice us. iPad didn't work right away, but he got us another to look over the beer.  Not into the food selection. Everything I have had has been good, but I have a hard time picking something that sounds good. Most places there are too many good options. Don't know if they have a veggie burger option, but it wasn't advertised if they do.  And their Ladies Night has a hash tag of #girlsdrinkbeer, but the specials are for well drinks and wine. But not beer?  Overall underwhelmed.

RFVbStH0u74Aso5bqEmENw.text: Went in sat at a table near the bar a guy came up who looked and acted drunk or high took our drink order and disappeared several people sat down after us and had their drink order so we moved to the bar after asking the bartender if it was because we won't getting service he said of course I'll take care of you and then he went to the bar and we sat there for another 5-6 minutes about to leave when he came over   Food was great except the meatballs which are way over cooked and have to eat so we left them when I told him he said oh well that's a shame and anyone offers new ones or take them off out bill   Overall I will try again because the food was good service sucked hopefully next time I'll get better service   I had shrimp tacos yummmm

5xu8c5FkPTCAUvgLkrj00A.text: Most people log into Yelp to complain but this is my first review and l'm taking the time to do so because the service was out of this world impressive. We were sat immediately, the server was there under 30 seconds introducing herself and brought waters without asking. The staff were super knowledgeable about the beer selection and our food once ordered arrived quickly. I never once had to look around and say, "where is my server" and they checked on us in a genuine and not pushy manner that made me feel they were authentic and striving to make each and every person that ate here tonight happy. Kudos to being in business for one whole year (9/28) and still keeping this level of concern for patrons. I will be back and I will bring friends.

N6Yiqf9xtGTDxtLsEwU09w.text: Great place. We had two kids with us and we asked to sit outside, our server was happy to do so. We used our yelp deal to get a free local beer. It was a good local brew.   The food we ordered was awesome, is recommend the chicken sliders! So epic. Also, the wings are great and big as well. If you're in the mood for some seafood, the calamari was also delicious!  Overall, the food was great, the staff were amazingly knowledgeable and friendly. I will be back the next time I'm in town!

6dw6aHk_JjNJuBfzbgRytA.text: This is my favorite spot to go when I'm hungry, and I need good food and beer as soon as possible. It's located at the Galleria Mall, but the entrance is on the outskirts of the mall so you don't have to worry about entering the mall period. It's a spacious spot, and they have booths, tall tables, you can sit outside and play some games, or just eat at the bar! On my most recent visit my boyfriend and I were sat down, and we didn't think we waited very long at all to be served. But our waiter was very apologetic about the wait, and continued to check up on us throughout our dinner. That goes to show they have a standard of their own! I always end up getting the two crispy chicken sliders with a side of fries. It's great for your pocket during happy hour which is Monday to Friday during 2-7pm and Sunday to Thursday during 9 to closing.

hb7CA0VjKkgQKPFI86mkzg.text: This started out as the place to hang but it has changed a bit. Still good beer selection but the food isn't anything extraordinary. Food is also pricey for what you get. They took a lot off their happy hour so it's not even worth it. I missed the calamari D=  However, overall the food and service is still good. I just feel it is not as good as when it opened.

HD3_Gj1-XWQ-7KoVF5y0gw.text: Love this place :))))))) I will recommend this place to all my Fiends Grate customer service we love it :::::))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))

eHdZ99EofkwUyFSpNPVNoA.text: Had a good experience here my first time. All the food options were quite good. Yes, I reccomend fhe pretzel. It is perfect bar food, though our entrees were perfectly enjoyable as well. Nevertheless, you must come here for the drinks. Why else would you? After all, the beer list is exceptional and they have some incredible offerings sure to please most any palate. My only complaint was the slow and inconsistent service as our server was clearly overwhelmed managing a gargantuan party, amongst some additional tables, and we definitely fell by the wayside.

SdcJIkkDATShrXB1Fffn-Q.text: Had such a blast last night!!! Really good live music and EXCELLENT SERVICE!!!! I had Erin as a server and she was so attentive and amazing, every question I had she never hesitated to answer and  point me in the right way and always kept a smile on her face!! Bartenders Sarah and Pua made some pretty delicious drinks and were also super friendly and attentive, the service alone is what will keep me coming back all the time!!! The food is also delicious lol but for me it's always about the service when it comes to a bar/restaurant and this place does it right, I'm so happy this place is here to stay and also close to my house hahahahaha   Just wanted to post again about how awesome this place is!! I can't believe all the negative reviews!! You people are crazy!!! I came in last night and again I had Erin as a server and Sarah was the bartender, I love seeing these girls they never let me down and always have my back when it comes to picking out the perfect beer!! Of course had another German pretzel with the delicious beer cheese!!! Another top notch night with my favorite beer place and girls!! THANK YOU WORLD OF BEER!!!

duxAgIR5az2onBsvkOYEDg.text: I walked in no one greeted me 15 minutes later I was finally told to have a seat anywhere I like. Keep in mind it was not busy. Right then I should have left. Finally I order my drinks and it takes over 30 mins for me to get them 45min later I get my food.  Order was all wrong .The waiter never came back until I was mad. I finally talked to the OWNER after he ignored me twice.  He then stated "look here" at the moment I flipped out left never eat the food or drinks and left. I suggest never go here horrible service and ownership.

OtpQ0dj-LTUrPEIF5daKqg.text: Okay, this place has so much potential. Back home we had a World of Beer, awesome place and food.   This location has great food and a grey beer selection. But my God..... the service is horrible! Bartenders hate their job and the manager was a little bit of an asshole who doesn't cater to his guests.  I will still come here, considering the wonderful Sunday deal. $23 for bottomless mimosas, beermosas, or blood Mary's plus a breakfast item. Can't beat that deal. But we felt like we were in church, small crowd, we asked to turn ONE of the games up (denied) then we asked if we could at least hear music  (denied). So basically we heard everyone's conversation the whole time we were there.   Again, this place has potential, if the manager and Bartenders didn't have such rude remarks I would be recommending this place. But not until they get it together

EHy11Lcb9LQ3_2aqEEKBEg.text: Cortea and Napua were great servers. Wings, street tacos and the new steak bowl were all very good. I cant believe how cheap the beer prices are here. $4 for a tall local beer, $3 for a labatt Blue! ( yes I'm an east coast guy) and for the win $5 for a kronenbourg 1664 wow that usually goes for $7-$9 depending on where you are in Vegas. Very good visit, the Bartender Matt was very knowledgeable about the billion beers they have here as well. A+

jcoIwDKf0EcLaXBOXBpykQ.text: I ordered a southwest burger and a goose IPA , burger was good nothing special , service was good bartender was nice.

eJWLdA_FKEBYQAVBEtwNTw.text: NO CHILLED GLASSES!  WTF IS WRONG WITH YOU?  We drove over here because we love our craft-beer.  We asked for a chilled glass and were told they don't serve chilled glasses.  My date and I turned around and left.  Seriously?  You call yourselves "World of Beer" and don't have chilled glasses?   UPDATE (response to response) Wolfgang.  I don't need it "explained" to me; get over your snobby self. There is no "confusion" on my part. Like many, many people, we like our craft-beer cold and in chilled glasses. If you don't want to offer it as an option, that is your choice; but you will lose our business.  We like our beer that way and don't need to be patronizingly educated about it as you seem to think.

uqUxyc9Sv0quvjA95Cvcrg.text: This has to be the best beer house I've been in. I believe they have 50 beers on tap. The service was fantastic. Everyone was very friendly and attentive. We had one of their appies and it was fantastic. Highly recommend this place.

9pD1boANYyGtMDyBq4DSeA.text: This place has a nice atmosphere and the live music was good!! Great beer selection! Service was slow and had to send my burger back because it was well done instead of medium-rare like I ordered. After waiting 10 minutes to ask them to fix it I had to flag down another waitress because our waiter was no where to be found. Worth a second try  8/26/2017 Been back a couple more times. Wait staff much better!!! Food coming out at ordered

IaJ6Ip72OeX6o3CLmDlfYg.text: It's really cool environment to hang out at...the servers are knowledgeable in the menu and the bartenders will assist you with every question you have!

ed6rGL83yCgeUW2KuCUF8Q.text: This is a perfect spot in Henderson for a relaxed classy bar! Big beautiful outdoor patio and delicious light food. Even kid friendly!

1D697PrfzLbpJKN1SiFBSg.text: So we've been there a few times now.  They were pretty cool the first day.  Then we went back for the grand opening.  They were ok.  Then the 3rd time we wen't seems like they don't seem to eger to serve you.  We had to flag someone down.  They were at the end of the bar chit chattin.  I like the bar and all the beer.  But my other problem is that they already started changing out there taps.   So as soon as you see one you like, it might be gone next time.   There are a couple of employees there that I like, but they usually work the tables, and we prefer to sit at the bar.....Maybe we need to go to a table.  We will see.

TwgokK0y26UnkADq3vm06g.text: Such a great place to just sit down with friends and try some drinks ! Food was great and the customer service is outstanding ! Everyone was so great and our server Derrinca was definitely wonderful !

bxiU5Jye61o1intT_gLYwA.text: Great atmosphere, reasonably priced food and drinks, and very friendly staff. I do have to say the food was just ok but everything else made up for that. I went with a group of 7 people and we were seated right away. We sat halfway on the patio and half inside so we could feel the nice breeze and watch the sunset. I will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of World of Beer - Henderson, NV, United States. We had to get the pretzel!

uTf_0rdVzzSVxaInDu9MGQ.text: Yay craft beer!!!! Great staff. Andrew, Matt, Nicole are the bestest. Super attentive and great with beer rec's.   I love the mac's cheese. Bratwurst Mondays or beerunch brunch Sunday.

O6---aAY0ijm4BCA_udbRw.text: The loaded tater tots with beer cheese were amazing. Shrimp tacos were really good too. And the waiter recommended an amber ale for my husband that he absolutely loved. Good food, good service, good beer!

7TVn2_I5hcD-fSXAsk5P1A.text: Absolutely love this place. They have such a wide variety of beers. Only downside is they typically don't have the same beer the next week but hey change is nice. Have tried most of their menu which is all pretty tasteful. The bartender Matt is the best! He's very knowledgeable and has great recommendations.

IXbN_gfQzxO8ApcDd5bJ1Q.text: My friend and I had a good time. We went during happy hour, which is 3-7pm. We tried almost all of the happy hour menu. The servings were a lot bigger than I expected, 5 star already!!! Definitely worth it for $5 each! Had the tacos, tried both chicken and barbacoas, which were full size ftw! Mac and cheese bites were bomb! The meatball sliders were okay, they were on the dry side but still tasty. Tater tots went really well with our flights of beer (not included in the happy hour) My favorite was the Margherita flat bread! Definitely must try, it was so goood!!!!!   The reason why we decided to go here was definitely the choices of beer, which did not disappoint, more than 500 beers to pick from. I had the local beers flight which were all delicious! Definitely will come back!

au7AyWEp4Oyt5iB02yAPaQ.text: Food is good, beer selection is great, and the service is always friendly. This is an overdue shout out as I have eaten here several times. They also have really good daily specials.

4lRHWLaUspoNHV4jsNJwbg.text: Went there for trivia last night.  It was their first trivia night.  So nothing went right.  They could not get the trivia questions on TV.  That would have been OK except that the sound system wasn't cranked up loud enough to  overcome the crowd noise.  Also, we couldn't hear the music round.  But the worst part was that they let a team of 10 win first place after announcing 3 times that teams with more than 6 cannot win.   Biggest beer selection I've ever seen (living up to their name).  The food was OK, but the portions were kinda small.

WlWm7UoC4FumjQPLajEGFw.text: Gonna keep it real simple.  Clean, spacious, bar seating, booths and tables. Outdoor patio as well. Dog friendly! Yes, yes and yes!!! Every time I've been here the service and help has been perfect.  No shortage of beer....55 draft taps, local brews, and the full rainbow etc.  They also have an infusion tower that puts a creative twist on your favorite beers infusing them with unique flavors.  Bottles, cans , drafts in the hundreds.  Sunday 11am-3pm bottomless booze brunch for $25.  As far as the food it's your pretty standard bar food mix up. I'd figure the beer is the main attraction and the food is the step child.  Beer, beer and more beer! Hooray for the beer!!!!!

UHt_EGIS607OKkux4eNo-g.text: First visit. Had the bibimbap and it was really done well and was tasty. Didn't have been so cannot comment on that but they have a large selection. Wife had a big juicy burger which she enjoyed.  Service was good and they weren't packed so they didn't mind us hanging out.  Standard chain store environment but was impressed with the menu

QD6bO0i_MdP3bT6rTiHjSw.text: This restaurant is always fantastic, and they have the best variety of beers in town. Service is always phenomenal although you sometimes have to be a bit patient when they are busy just like anywhere else.  Totally worth it for the beer and the food. Shout out to servers like Aubrey and Erin who are good people and great servers. My husband and I have been going here regularly since they opened and have never had a bad experience. Also a great place to watch the golden knights!

36PNv1WoR5GeLFR8eb30lA.text: Check out the happy hour you won't regret it! Chicken tacos are FIRE! Great atmosphere, friendly staff, and if Matt is there he'll answer all your beer questions no doubt. Look into their live music too!

5weXsobqb0negL8ZFH3cVg.text: Love this place and the food but not as much as the service! Dave was great and managers are super nice and love that theres always a new beer to try :)

sqmOZgihEslu0qRnEuslcQ.text: My man and I came in tonight for the first time in months and the service was horrible :( There were about 6-7 other tables with 2 servers on so it wasn't super busy but we were there for 45 minutes and never got to order our dinner! My bf had finished his beer and we had both been finished with our apps, but we had to look around the restaurant trying to make eye contact with our server for 5-10 minutes before he came back over to us and unapologetically asked if we were ready to order. A table that came in after us, ordered and received their food by the time our server came back for us. We just took the check and left hungry because we didn't feel like waiting another 45 minutes to eat. We both work in bars/restaurants so we're always really understanding when it's busy but we should not have been waiting there for that long.

uHO0iebCQmHonzXF-X4u3Q.text: I love stouts and this awesome chic with blue hair , (fredi) gave three examples of stouts and you finally decided on the peanut butter stout by Belching Beaver on nitro and it was delicious. She made sure me and my girls had everything we needed. We WILL be back. Fredi let us know Monday is 5$ burger day, can't wait :) This place has a great selection of craft beers plus 5 star service!

Cevs7xPD1aNpka4i6OotWQ.text: We stopped at WoB for a beer and lunch after some stressful mall shopping. What a great surprise. Pua was behind the bar. Great service and funny sense of humor.  We had the chicken street tacos and the Guinness brat. Very tasty. But let's face it, you come here for the beer. I like stouts and they do have many to chose from. I will definitely be back. If you haven't been there, check it out. If you have, I'm sure I'll see you soon.

7bem-nHAGOu4VUbc7AWXhg.text: I stopped here with a friend for a quick bite and adult beverages. The beer selection is fantastic and the foods we ordered were great. We had a flatbread pizza along with Mac and cheese bites. All was delicious. Service was good. Atmosphere is more bar like and less restaurant like in nature. Good to know this place is attached to the mall and close to home too. Nice addition to the Galleria area.

s7PaymuCpTHPtxYFbph3rA.text: Amazing beer selection, friendly staff and great food! They recently came out with new menu items and I am one satisfied customer. I come here about once a month to check out the new beers they rotate on draft. Sometimes when its busy its a bit slower service but the servers and bartenders always keep an eye on my beer and check in which is nice. Its a very laid back environment that i can really unwind in. Its not your typical restaurant that you want to get in and out of in 30 minutes, unless its lunch time which also has some deals on the lunch menu. Knights games, Trivia nights and Live music are my favorite times to go as well, its more of a going out for the night kind of vibe without all the Vegas traffic and wierdos. I highly recommend this place if you are have a positive attitude and good vibes, no place is perfect but for this price, quality and selection you cant be mad!

PH7yy1noIBXUeikSY1W-0g.text: Went again tonight. Small crowd. Not very crowded. Great service, and the food I remember. Plus everything on the receipt was correct. This is the WOB I remember and love.

h1jDZof4jRQSK6R_LzGr6Q.text: Great sports bar with open feel to it. Dog are sitting outside durning the Knights game with special for the game. When we got to the bar we were greeted immediately by one of the bartenders, unfortunately I forgot his name I think it was Eric, but either way he was great! He got me to try the local Hefeweizen which was pretty good and I usually just drink Stouts which he let me sample a few they had on tap. s9lbQzA8hTlv1TRkZhCmDA.text: I'm reviewing on the pretty awesome sun-thur happy hour which I'm a fan of..big FAN of!  Service:  I've always say at the bar for the evening happy hour and the bartenders have all been great.  Always checking on your drinks and food to make sure everything is going well.  Food & Drinky Drinks: The beers I've ordered on draft off the happy hour menu have always been cold, optimally stored and never flat.  My favorite happy hour foods all at $5 Margherita Flatbread:  Tasty and great value for the price.   Mac & Cheese Bites: 6 bites that work very well with the dipping sauce Crispy Chicken Sliders: you get 2 sliders  and the chicken is flavorful All the happy hour food specials is great drinking food especially with beer, go figure  Ambiance: Lots of big TVs above the bar which can be seen throughout the whole establishment.  It gives off a PT's Gold vibe: Local, clean, contemporary with lots of dark wood.  I'm love seeing all the different bar taps and the impressive fridges of bottled beer for the sampling  This is a place for beer drinkers as the selection is fantastic.  The food has always been good to great and I've never had any issues.  I love how the menus provide information on calories and what type of beer would pair best with the entrees.  I totally appreciate them making me a better foodie through their menu.  I think it's time for a non-happy hour visit to try pair up a main entree with their beer suggestions and I'm excited to try that.  But that's another yelp tale....=)

EQthp7AzX-clfxOYFSpLNA.text: I feel like if I had any other server my first experience here would not have been so awful. I came in with my boyfriend and his friend and we stood at the front for a while not sure if it was the "seat yourself" type of place or if a host was suppose to seat you. So after standing up there for a long time without being helped we figured we could just walk in and sit down wherever. We walked over to the only open booth at the time and it was dirty so we just stood in front of it waiting to be helped. Finally someone saw us and cleaned it off for us and brought us some menus. After 15 minutes of sitting there and not being helped our server, Andrew, finally came over to take our drink order. Then it took him such a long time to bring us three waters. Finally after waiting a total of 20-30 minutes JUST for waters, he took our beer/food orders. I decided to get the Belgian s'mores waffle since I recently ate. I wanted to get a vodka cranberry but I knew it wouldn't go well with the waffle and asked him what to do. Instead of suggesting drinks that I might like with the waffle, his response was "Yeah, the vodka cranberry wouldn't go well with that waffle." So I ordered the waffle and was looking through the beer list while waiting for it to come. The waffle arrived at a decent time and I was surprise to find out it wasn't even a full waffle. They were four tiny bite-sized pieces. With no help from Andrew, I found the double chocolate stout beer and I really wanted that with my dessert. My only problem was that Andrew already dropped off the waffle and DID NOT come back to the table after that for a very long time. I could not wait any longer so I decided to eat it with only water. After 30 long minutes without being checked on and finishing my four bite-sized waffle pieces (which was absolutely delicious, it's the only reason this review gets two stars instead of one), he finally came back. I asked him for a refill of water since I was without water for most of my meal and for the double chocolate stout beer. Once I ordered that beer he had the AUDACITY to tell me "That would have been good with the waffle." Are you kidding me? I WAS TRYING TO ORDER THAT WITH MY WAFFLE BUT YOU NEVER CAME BACK TO CHECK ON US. AND I EVEN ASKED FOR HIS OPINION FROM THE BEGINNING BUT ALL HE SAID WAS THAT VODKA CRANBERRY WAS "NOT A GOOD MATCH." So I angrily responded "Oh I know." Then it took him 15 minutes to bring us the chocolate stout (it could've been the bartender's fault, but at this point, I doubt it). Finally it comes, along with another beer for my boyfriend's friend. My boyfriend wanted to make another beer order but he never came back after dropping off the chocolate stout. At this point we had been there for AN HOUR AND A HALF and did not even order that much. We look around the restaurant and find him flirting with some girls at another table. Once he was finally done doing that we asked him for the check (WHICH TOOK HIM A GOOD 10 MINUTES, WHY?!???) He put it all on one check so we asked for it to be split and he split it almost immediately and brought it back (fastest thing he did all night). We left our cards at the edge of the table for another 10 minutes until he finally came by to take them. My boyfriend's friend stiffed him and my boyfriend tipped him $1. We ALWAYS tip 20% for decent-good service. We all work in the food industry so we know how it can be sometimes but this was absolutely AWFUL AND SLOW service. We were finally able to leave after TWO HOURS. We saw that his main priority was clearly to flirt with the women at the other table. I will give this place another try sometime in the future, and when I do I'll make sure Andrew isn't my server.

3fobwFTLvn7tHAvDFpfebQ.text: Hello and welcome to World of Beer. I was meeting a buddy of mine to catch up on life and enjoy a few beers, so I suggested we meet here since I have been wanting to try it. I arrived early and ordered a nice crisp cold beer which came in Goblet style glass. I ordered 2 beers the first was Fastback Racer, which had a citrus and rye notes. Hop forward and has some bitterness but amazingly drinkable. For an appetizer we had the tater Tots. Tater tots topped with our homemade beer cheese, jalapenos, crispy bacon, scallions & sour cream. These are really good. I like things spicy so having a chance to have a bite of jalapeno with a few tots was quite good. This is a big App so be careful not to fill up on these. I also had the dry rub chicken wings with house made blue cheese. Average wings but the home made blue cheese made up for it. They are more famous for some of their German food creations so I had minimum expectations of the wings. My friend had the schnitzel and he said it was good and flavorful. The staff was very accommodating explaining the different beers and food. The crowd was minimal for a Thursday night and atmosphere was calm and quiet. There were a few families here so don't be discouraged to bring your brood. Thank you for dining at World of Beer. I hope to go back here soon. I like all the choices of beer and I believe I saw a beer club that I would like to tackle. Some menu choices also looked inviting and would like to try a few different things. If at Galleria mall and want to get a cold frosty one and a good snack swing by and soak this joint in.

Iv34kgXWhYiWfCAyV7t0FQ.text: I guess the best way to describe this place is to say it is exactly what it is, a bar with beer and beer snacks.  Environment: pretty much a sports bar with some tv screens for games. This spot is pretty much a pretty chill spot to hang out with friends and have some beer. They have live music, but I have not experienced it myself.  Service: there usually aren't too many waitress so the times I have been here, I often had to wait a while to order and pay my check. They are all super friendly, but for some reason, there is always a big of a lag with the low staff. I would say if you are planning on staying here for a while, it would be more fitting, but not for a quick drink or meal.   Food and drinks: I have only had their pretzel here, and I think it is actually very good. The dips for it, cheese beer and mustard are for some reason not that great. I think the mustard was a bit sour and the cheese cooled off too quickly, but the pretzel itself is bomb. The beer option is very vast and you have so many to select from. Their cocktails are good, but the beer is usually why people show up here.  Overall, I think this is a good spot for after work or late night beer and snacks. Things run pretty slowly here, but i can see it being a pretty good spot to catch up with friends and nurse a beer.

Super bowl Sunday, he the owner (hairy old guy), could be seen cussing at employees in front of us (customers) and then rubbing the shoulders of the younger female employees. It really was enough that we actually left and watched elsewhere.   Apparently the #metoo movement hasn't made it this far into Henderson yet.   What we (hubby and I) previously recommended as a cool place to go is no longer cool. No pretzel or beer is good enough to watch an old guy prey on younger employees.  Sadly, we rescind our recommendation of this place.

y-K8t62EzSlRETDJgSj2Vg.text: We've been to WOB a couple times for happy hour. The first time about a month ago was on a Friday night and it was pretty good. Lots of people and live music. Beer selection is great. We ordered some tacos and wings and the food was okay - typical bar food. Tonight we went, also a Friday night, but there was hardly anyone there and there was no live music. 5pm happy hour on a Friday night and the place was empty? The main reason for the one star is that we order nachos and they were horrible. Tasted like they poured fake cheese from a can or jar over then. Could have counted the number of black beans on one hand. The sour cream was runny and thin. Most of the Chips were dry without even the fake cheese on them. Really awful. We will not be back.

9le_6QsOjZ0g_liQBWtYDg.text: Worst service I've ever had, showed up on Sunday 12/23/18 around 10:50am, 3 people at the bar, and it took the bartender 20 minutes to take one persons Bloody Mary order then he forgot to make it, I waited 25 minutes hoping this burn out would actually offer to pour me a beer and got fed up and left. This place used to be awesome! What the heck happened? My bartender was too stoned to realize he was at work!! Will never return

JHSF5GZzZqpYN_GQRIWfZQ.text: Recently went with my boyfriend and had the worst service ever! And the food left much to be desired. Monique was our server and I would definitely avoid her service if possible! We were greeted shortly after being seated. She asked us for drink orders and we weren't quite ready so we asked for waters. After about 5 minutes she dropped off the waters and we ordered food - my BF a burger and beer cheese nachos for me. I still hadn't decided on my beer so the waitress said she would put in the food order and be back. After 5 minutes I had decided what beer to get and we waited for our server. We saw several other servers attending to nearby tables yet no sign of Monique. After about 10 minutes of waiting (I went to the bathroom and saw our server inside cleaning tables) another server stopped by and asked if she could help so we ordered our beers. About a minute later our server arrives and we told her we had placed our beer orders. So we waited another 10 minutes and got our beers. Now at this point we had been here about 30 minutes and still no food. We watched as another table behind us who ordered food after us received their food. We finally flagged down our server and asked about our food. She said she would go check on our food order. We saw another couple get seated and receive their food within 10 minutes. Monique comes back and tells us the kitchen is backed up and she will make sure to get us a discount. At this time a family of 4 (parents and 2 kids) are seated next to us. They receive their drinks (sodas and alcohol) within 5 minutes. After about 10 minutes someone else brings out our food. At this point I ask to see the manager as it is ridiculous to wait 45 minutes for a burger and nachos. At this point this person identifies herself as the manager. She apologizes with no explanation and offers us a discount or to comp our next round of drinks. My BF's burger was good but nothing special. My nachos were mediocre. The beer cheese tasted like regular nacho cheese and there were very few pieces of chicken which I paid extra for. Not worth waiting for more than half an hr. Shortly after we get our food the family of 4 gets their meals. The part that is disappointing is that clearly the server Monique forgot to put in our order. Clearly there was no "back up" in the kitchen as multiple other tables who arrived and ordered after us received their food in a timely manner. If you make a mistake own up to it. And if you are a manager identify yourself as such and speak up prior to the customer complaining to help appease the situation. I have worked in the food industry and there is no need to blame the kitchen if you as a server forget to place the order. The whole situation was poorly handled by the server and manager. The other servers appeared to be doing their job correctly while ours was clearly lacking. We have been here before and never had an issue. Needless to say we will not be back. Seriously waiting 40 minutes for nachos? No thanks. Horrible service and mediocre food for the prices? Not worth it. Monique - 2 thumbs down.

5OdiAkT7Dm52ceaPPpvVeA.text: I came from Portland Oregon, a serious beer town and was looking for a decent taproom, with a sophisticated selection as well as good food. FOUND IT IN WOB! They do an awesome brunch special on the weekend during football season and have drinks specials in addition to a more than reasonable happy hour. Brunch is something like $30 bottomless mimosas and an entree. Oh and ask about the refrigerator case drinks offers! They rotate daily. The food is good but they could use some more menu items that are vegetarian/vegan friendly. An awesome place to watch sports as well.

photos.caption: Photo of World of Beer - Henderson, NV, United States

nO8WoROLfLvOIsKIdFfjUg.text: To say that I'm a fan of beer, would be an understatement. I also am a fan of having options to choose what type of beer I want, which changes based on my mood and what I'm eating. World of Beer has so many different options on tap, bottles and can, that anyone can find something to get. They also have a lot of beer from the local breweries, which is a good way to make a chain seem a little smaller.  They have a good happy hour as well, which goes from 3 - 7. I almost never find a beer I'm interested in on it, but they food options are wide ranging. Another nice feature is the patio. It has its own bar section, multiple seating options, and even televisions to accommodate everyone. I have used it many times when summer is not making it less enjoyable.   If you are in the area and looking for either a fun bar to go to or a good happy hour, check this place out.

XE0E1x_Y2dfp4jrycROVWA.text: This is the place for the beer enthusiast. We've spent a couple of long Saturday nights here watching football trying to make a dent into the 500+ beers they have in-house. We've had some of the food which didn't have us in awe, nor did it disappoint. Service can be slow, but the knowledge of beer, especially from the bartenders, will definitely impress.   This number of taps isn't as many as other places such as Yard House, but what they miss in numbers, they make up for by having taps that rotate daily and a significant number of local brews or limited releases like the 17% Dogfish Oak Aged Vanilla World Wide Stout which is one of the strongest yet most flavorful beers I've had in recent history. They keep the selection spectrum wide enough, and well organized in their app, to keep any beer drinker happy. I'm always up for trying any of their nitro brews, which they usually have three to four tapped.  Also unique to WOB is their infusion tower and cask engine which can be hit or miss depending on the flavors you're in to. Feel free to ask for a taste, you won't get any opposition. What I did see being used regularly and should be implemented in every bar with taps is the star sink, or glass rinser. That extra rinse will lead a to a cleaner glass and pour which will allow you to appreciate the flavors and aromas.  The food was what we expected and everything was made to order. On the menu, they'll have beer suggestions to pair with your food. Unless we're starving and want a separate entree for ourselves, we just usually get shareable stuff and snack throughout the night so we can focus on the beer which is what we are here for. But you can't go wrong with the obligatory nachos and pretzel.  If you're one and done or a two-pump chump as far as the number of beers you drink, the night will be affordable, but if you're in it for the long haul and come in on a Saturday like we did, bring a Grant and probably a few extra Jacksons. Our tabs for two have both been $100+ before tip on both nights. Otherwise make sure to take advantage of their happy hour 2-7 M-F and reverse happy hour Sun-Thur 9-close offering $4 drafts, $5 spirits and shareables, and $6 wines. They also have a rewards program where you'll earn with every dollar spent. I'll keep an eye on the app when they bring in the next beer I'm looking for.

2EW8WETRxReaV51q8LYBjA.text: I'm happy this place opened up at the Galleria Mall a few years ago. It's a great neighborhood place to drop in for a tasty brew and a bite to eat. Michael tried the Pork Schnitzel and said it was good, but a bit bland. (I tend to find all schnitzel bland, but that's just me). The tavern pretzel is a favorite there although we didn't order it this time. The place gets a bit noisy, with sports on the many flat screens and all of the lively conversations going on. But we were still able to hear each other at our table. There's a nice outdoor patio area, as well. We've sat there a few times in the past, and enjoyed it.

7uwpG96FHyHWlRtQuyEbOw.text: I'd really like to give this place a decent review, and would have after most of our past visits. We typically go to Gen (Korean BBQ next door - highly recommend) once or twice a month. The wait is usually long enough at Gen that we stop in WOB for a beer or two while we wait. We've always had pretty decent and timely service. The last time we were there we waited a while to be sat (they were busy). By the time we had a table, we waited another 5-10 minutes for a server. We already knew what we wanted (2 beers total) so ordered right away. After waiting another 15 minutes, we got a text that our table at Gen was ready. We tried to look for our server to cancel our order, but couldn't find her, so we left. After being seated at Gen, a woman from WOB walked over to our table to tell us we had to pay for the beers we ordered but were never served (or drank). We didn't want to argue, but we did feel it was a bit ridiculous given how long we had waited without even being served. She invited us to come in after our meal to have the beers we paid for, but we really have no desire to go back.
